bio: A famous Indian chef known for his TV show 'Khana Khazana'

recipe.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces
steps: Mix together the yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Add the chicken pieces and marinate for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight.
Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Thread the chicken pieces onto skewers and brush with oil.
Place the skewers on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked through.
In a separate pan, heat the cream and garam masala.
Add the cooked chicken pieces to the pan and stir until well coated with the sauce.
Serve hot.

recipe.name: Butter Naan
steps: In a bowl, mix together the flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda.
Add the yogurt, milk, melted butter, and coriander leaves.
Knead the dough for 5-7 minutes, until it becomes smooth and elastic.
Cover the dough and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 500°F.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll them out into thin circles.
Place the circles on a baking sheet and bake for 5-7 minutes, or until lightly browned.
Brush the naan with melted butter before serving.

recipe.name: Paneer Makhani
steps: Heat butter in a pan and add chopped onion, ginger, garlic, and green chili. Sauté until onion turns golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Mix well.
Add kasuri methi and salt. Mix well.
Add paneer cubes and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add cream and mix well. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.

bio: Tarla Dalal was an Indian food writer, chef, and television host. She was one of India's best-selling cookbook authors and was known for her easy-to-follow recipes.

recipe.name: Palak Paneer
steps: Blanch spinach in hot water for 2-3 minutes and immediately drain.
Blend the blanched spinach, green chili, and ginger to a smooth paste.
Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
Add onion and sauté until translucent.
Add chopped tomato and sauté until it turns mushy.
Add the spinach paste and mix well.
Add garam masala and salt.
Add paneer cubes and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Palak paneer is ready to serve.

recipe.name: Butter Chicken
steps: Marinate the chicken in curd, ginger-garlic paste, and some spices for 2 hours.
Grill the chicken in the oven for 10-12 minutes or until cooked through.
Heat butter in a pan and add ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add kasuri methi, red chili powder, and salt.
Add cream and mix well.
Add grilled chicken and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Butter chicken is ready to serve.

recipe.name: Chana Masala
steps: Soak chickpeas overnight and pressure cook until soft.
Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
Add onion and sauté until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomato and cook until it turns mushy.
Add cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt.
Add cooked chickpeas and mix well.
Add water and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Chana masala is ready to serve.

bio: Vikas Khanna is an Indian-American chef, restaurateur, cookbook writer, filmmaker, humanitarian, and the judge of MasterChef India.

recipe.name: Butter Chicken
steps: Marinate the chicken with yogurt and spices.
Grill the chicken until cooked.
Prepare the sauce by sautéing onions, ginger, and garlic. Add tomatoes and cook until softened.
Blend the tomato mixture and strain it to make a smooth sauce.
Add butter and spices to the sauce and cook until fragrant.
Add the grilled chicken to the sauce and simmer for a few minutes.
Stir in heavy cream and kasuri methi and serve hot.

recipe.name: Rogan Josh
steps: Marinate the lamb with yogurt and spices.
Sauté onions, ginger, and garlic in a pan. Add tomatoes and cook until softened.
Add spices and lamb to the pan and cook until browned.
Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the lamb is tender.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipe.name: Samosas
steps: Boil and mash the potatoes.
Sauté onion, ginger, and green chili in a pan. Add peas and cook until softened.
Add spices and mashed potatoes to the pan and cook for a few minutes.
Cut the pastry dough into triangles.
Place a spoonful of filling in the center of each triangle and fold the edges to form a triangle.
Deep fry the samosas until golden brown and serve hot with chutney.

bio: An Indian celebrity chef, restaurateur and television personality.

recipe.name: Paneer Makhani
steps: Heat butter in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates from the mixture.
Add cashew paste, red chili powder, and garam masala and cook for a minute.
Add paneer and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add cream and kasuri methi and cook for a minute.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

recipe.name: Baingan Bharta
steps: Roast eggplants on a flame until charred and cooked from inside.
Remove the skin and mash the eggplants.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger, garlic, and green chilies and sauté for a minute.
Add tomatoes and cook until the mixture becomes soft.
Add mashed eggplants, red chili powder, and garam masala and cook for a few minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or rice.

recipe.name: Kadhi Pakora
steps: Mix yogurt, besan, salt, and water in a bowl to form a smooth batter.
Heat oil in a pan and fry pakoras made of besan and onions until golden brown.
Add fenugreek seeds, cumin seeds, and asafoetida and sauté for a minute.
Add the yogurt-besan mixture and cook on low heat until it thickens.
Add fried pakoras and cook for a few minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

bio: Madhur Jaffrey is an Indian actress, food and travel writer, and television personality. She is recognized for bringing Indian cuisine to the western world and has written over 30 cookbooks.

recipe.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
steps: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, turmeric, garam masala, and paprika for at least 1 hour.
Grill the chicken until cooked through.
In a separate pan, sauté onions and spices until fragrant.
Add in chopped tomatoes and cook until softened.
Add in the grilled chicken and cream.
Simmer until the chicken is coated in the sauce.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.

recipe.name: Baingan Bharta
steps: Char the eggplant over an open flame until the skin is blackened and the flesh is soft.
Peel the skin off the eggplant and chop the flesh.
In a separate pan, sauté onions, ginger, and green chili until softened.
Add in chopped tomatoes and spices and cook until softened.
Add in the chopped eggplant and cook until everything is combined.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.

recipe.name: Chana Masala
steps: In a separate pan, sauté onions, ginger, and garlic until softened.
Add in chopped tomatoes and spices and cook until softened.
Add in the chickpeas and cook until everything is combined.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.
